==Trivia==
* {{Transclude|Nymphs' Tea Party|OrdoLeitmotif|section=1}}
* The term {{Fr|rondeau}}, which stems from {{Fr|rond|round,}} has various meanings in French, primarily related to arts:
** It is a {{w|circle dance}} originating from {{w|Gascony}}. It is usually performed with 4 to 5 persons with their hands or arms tied, it can also be a dance for two.
** In poetry, a {{Fr|{{w|Rondeau (forme fixe)|rondeau}}}} is one of the {{Fr|{{w|Forme fixe|formes fixes}}|fixed forms}} along with the {{Fr|virelai}} and the {{Fr|ballade}}. It is structured around a fixed pattern of repetition of verse with a refrain.
** A {{w|rondo}}, also spelled rondeau, is a musical form that contains a principal theme, which alternates with one or more contrasting themes.
